creator: nice03@ilead.co.kr
text:
Probably related to these log messages I'm seeing in my logs (linux) whenever an
SSL connection comes in:

[27/Apr/2002 10:20:45 14779] [warn]  Init: (test.co.kr:443) RSA server 
certificate is a CA certificate (BasicConstraints
: CA == TRUE !?)

What exactly are the consequences of this warning I see in the logs
(/home/apache/conf/ssl_engine_log)?

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
Not part of Apache until 2.0 was released... 

you need to refer to http://www.modssl.org
